pairs: ["Recently, courts have held that debt collectors can escape 1692i's venue provisions entirely by pursuing debt collection through arbitration instead.\tRecently, courts have held that debt collectors can escape 1692i's venue provisions entirely by pursuing debt collection through arbitration instead.", "Recently, courts have held that debt collectors can escape 1692i's venue provisions entirely by pursuing debt collection through arbitration instead.\tAs the NAF studies reflect, arbitration has not proven a satisfactory alternative.", "Recently, courts have held that debt collectors can escape 1692i's venue provisions entirely by pursuing debt collection through arbitration instead.\tI urge the CFPB to include in a rule language interpreting 1692i as requiring debt collectors to proceed in court, not through largely-unregulated arbitral forums.", "As the NAF studies reflect, arbitration has not proven a satisfactory alternative.\tRecently, courts have held that debt collectors can escape 1692i's venue provisions entirely by pursuing debt collection through arbitration instead.", 'As the NAF studies reflect, arbitration has not proven a satisfactory alternative.\tAs the NAF studies reflect, arbitration has not proven a satisfactory alternative.', 'As the NAF studies reflect, arbitration has not proven a satisfactory alternative.\tI urge the CFPB to include in a rule language interpreting 1692i as requiring debt collectors to proceed in court, not through largely-unregulated arbitral forums.', "I urge the CFPB to include in a rule language interpreting 1692i as requiring debt collectors to proceed in court, not through largely-unregulated arbitral forums.\tRecently, courts have held that debt collectors can escape 1692i's venue provisions entirely by pursuing debt collection through arbitration instead.", 'I urge the CFPB to include in a rule language interpreting 1692i as requiring debt collectors to proceed in court, not through largely-unregulated arbitral forums.\tAs the NAF studies reflect, arbitration has not proven a satisfactory alternative.', 'I urge the CFPB to include in a rule language interpreting 1692i as requiring debt collectors to proceed in court, not through largely-unregulated arbitral forums.\tI urge the CFPB to include in a rule language interpreting 1692i as requiring debt collectors to proceed in court, not through largely-unregulated arbitral forums.']

['To avoid consumers getting sued repeatedly on the same debt, the CFPB should require or encourage states to adopt rules requiring that judgments be preclusive of future consumer-collector litigation on the same debt;\tTo avoid consumers getting sued repeatedly on the same debt, the CFPB should require or encourage states to adopt rules requiring that judgments be preclusive of future consumer-collector litigation on the same debt;', 'To avoid consumers getting sued repeatedly on the same debt, the CFPB should require or encourage states to adopt rules requiring that judgments be preclusive of future consumer-collector litigation on the same debt;\tinstead, if there is a dispute between assignees as to who has title to the debt, they should work it out between themselves instead of risking subjecting the consumer to multiple liability.', 'instead, if there is a dispute between assignees as to who has title to the debt, they should work it out between themselves instead of risking subjecting the consumer to multiple liability.\tTo avoid consumers getting sued repeatedly on the same debt, the CFPB should require or encourage states to adopt rules requiring that judgments be preclusive of future consumer-collector litigation on the same debt;', 'instead, if there is a dispute between assignees as to who has title to the debt, they should work it out between themselves instead of risking subjecting the consumer to multiple liability.\tinstead, if there is a dispute between assignees as to who has title to the debt, they should work it out between themselves instead of risking subjecting the consumer to multiple liability.']

['I am an experienced recipient of collection calls.\tI am an experienced recipient of collection calls.', 'I am an experienced recipient of collection calls.\tAs I have explained in another post here, I live in a fairly large metro area,', "I am an experienced recipient of collection calls.\tand whenever anyone with my very common last name and first initial skips town without paying his/her bills, I'm the one who gets the calls from the debt collectors.", 'I am an experienced recipient of collection calls.\tI know that a call about "an important business matter," is a call about a debt.', 'I am an experienced recipient of collection calls.\tI have received many of these kinds of calls.', "I am an experienced recipient of collection calls.\tWhenever a debt collector calls me and leaves a message without a name, it doesn't take me very long to figure out that the call is from a debt collector.", 'I am an experienced recipient of collection calls.\tIf the debt collector calls and leaves a name, that debt collector is revealing to me, an unrelated third party, that the individual has a debt in collection.', 'I am an experienced recipient of collection calls.\tI consider
